meanings.definition: To have a paralyzing or mesmerizing effect on someone.
meanings.sent1: The magician's spell seemed to gorgonize the audience, holding them in awe.
meanings.sent2: The beautiful artwork had the power to gorgonize anyone who gazed upon it.
meanings.sent3: The cat's intense stare seemed to gorgonize the curious mouse.
meanings.sent4: The music had a gorgonizing effect, freezing the listeners in place.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious painting had the ability to gorgonize all who viewed it.

meanings.definition: To petrify or turn to stone.
meanings.sent1: Medusa's gaze was said to gorgonize anyone who dared to look at her.
meanings.sent2: The ancient curse could gorgonize a person with just a glance.
meanings.sent3: The legend tells of a creature that could gorgonize its enemies with a single stare.
meanings.sent4: The spell was so powerful that it could gorgonize a whole army in seconds.
meanings.sent5: The magical artifact had the ability to gorgonize anyone who touched it.

meanings.definition: To stare at someone in a way that makes them feel uncomfortable or frightened.
meanings.sent1: The suspicious man continued to gorgonize the shopkeeper with his intense gaze.
meanings.sent2: The eerie painting seemed to gorgonize those who looked at it for too long.
meanings.sent3: The creepy doll's eyes appeared to gorgonize anyone who dared to meet its stare.
meanings.sent4: The haunted house had a way to gorgonize visitors with its spooky atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The ghostly figure seemed to gorgonize the travelers as they passed by.
